boardgame.name: Marvel Zombies: X-Men Resistance
boardgame.description:
When the zombie plague strikes, not even Earth’s mightiest heroes are safe. Marvel Zombies is a cooperative board game for 1 to 6 players, based on the core mechanics of the smash hit Zombicide series, bringing non-stop zombie action to the Marvel universe. The original art by comics legend Marco Checchetto is brought to life in amazing game pieces depicting the iconic Marvel characters in glorious (and often gory) detail.

In Marvel Zombies: X-Men Resistance, players control the last surviving Super Heroes (Hero Mode). The X-Men and their mutant nemeses unite against the zombie threat.

Each Super Hero has unique skills that get unlocked the more zombies you eliminate.

Players can use actions to acquired various Traits. These single-use cards boost their skills in various ways.

Hiding in buildings or being hunted by zombies, Bystanders are often your primary objectives. Rescuing them gives you a permanent ability unique to each one.

Your actions can increase your heroic Power, which in turn can be spent for bonus dice or to trigger special Skill and Trait effects.

The more experiences and powerful you get, the larger the hordes of infected that will spawn to hunt you down every round. They could be lurking inside any room.

The apocalypse gets in full swing when a Zombie Hero rises to hunt you, Death has not weakened their unique powers.

Modular tiles faithfully recreate the X-Mansion in amazing detail. Over the course of 10 Missions you'll make your stand on the ground floor, the upstairs student dorms, and the underground X-Men facilities.

The box also contains the cards needed to use its Heroes and Bystanders in Zombie Mode, as well as unique Zombie Mode missions. The Marvel Zombies core box is needed to play in Zombie Mode.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Artist's Special Edition Set
Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Clash of the Sinister Six
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Extra Dice Set
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Fantastic Four: Under Siege
Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Galactus the Devourer
Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Guardians of the Galaxy Set
Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Hydra Resurrection
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Plastic Tokens
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Promos Box
Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Sentinel Strike
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Tile Set

listing.notes: *** PREORDER WITH EXPECTED DELIVERY Q2 2023*** Contents: Kickstarter Edition of Marvel Zombies X-Men Resistance Board Game by CMON. Includes core game. Order this Board Game now and Get FREE SHIPPING in the Continental US! Please note: unless otherwise stated paid add ons from the Kickstarter Campaign are not included.

boardgame.name: Flamecraft: The Spice Tower and Flamestarter Statue
boardgame.description:
The Spice Tower and Flamestarter Statue are additional shops for Flamecraft available via the Kickstarter and as a promo pack.

The Spice Tower is a wild goods shop with the power to either double a good you have or provide 5 goods of a type you don't have. The artwork is a reference to a well-known content producer and contains many board game puns in the background.

Flamestarter Statue is a high reputation shop that has the unique ability to allow players to gain dragons that have been previously placed.
—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: אתגר החלל (Space Challenge)
boardgame.description:
Players draw cards from their hand to move across the board collecting asteroids and faults.

A round ends when all participants arrived at one of the stations or were disqualified due to malfunctions and left the game

After 3 rounds count the number of asteroids collected by the participant. The player with the most, wins.


Hebrew only:
התקדמו לאורך המסלול ואספו אסטרואידים, שלוש תקלות והחללית תתרסק. רק הראשון שיגיע לסיום המסלול ומי שיצליח לחזור לארץ בבטחה יקבל את הנקודות

boardgame.name: Podmieńcy
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

To gra fabularna o podmieńcach, czyli wróżkach wcielonych w ludzkie ciała. Przebywając na ziemi, muszą zapanować nad swoją sprzeczną naturą podczas walki o sprawę, która przywołała ich do świata śmiertelników.

Postacie
W trakcie rozgrywki uczestnicy kierują postaciami Podmieńców. Piękny lud, faerie, wróżki – dawno temu odeszli wraz z rozwojem cywilizacji i triumfem banalności. Przywołani ludzkimi marzeniami o lepszym świecie wracają jako podmieńcy. Pełni gniewu na świat, który ich odrzucił, na ludzi, którzy zabrali z niego magię i zastąpili ją tabelkami Excela. Wróżki obleczone w ciało człowieka znajdują sprawę, za którą chcą walczyć. Przychodzą do słabych i wykluczonych, żeby im pomóc.

Świat
To urban fantasy, przebłyski magii w brudnym zmęczonym świecie. Świecie, który płonie – katastrofa klimatyczna, galopujące nierówności, wszechwładne korporacje i próbujący się im przeciwstawiać politycy podsycający nienawiść. Miliarderzy, którym coraz bliżej do głównych złych z Bonda. Trzecia dekada XXI wieku zapowiada się gorzej niż poprzednie. Są jednak przebłyski nadziei.

Zasady
Podmieńcy to duży hack Strzyg, który korzysta z mechaniki, struktury i świata oryginału, żeby dać graczom nowe możliwości. Zasady bazują na grze „Lasers & Feelings” – są krótkie, proste, nastawione na narrację, improwizację i wspólne tworzenie historii. Całość została stworzona z myślą o krótkich, pełnych akcji sesjach rozgrywanych bez uprzedniego przygotowania.

Nie wymaga znajomości oryginału.

boardgame.name: Pajarracos Party
boardgame.description:
Pajarracos Party is a fun and family card game. With 90 cards of fruits, birds and different effects that will help or harm you during the game.

How to play Pajarracos Party?


Draw 5 random cards to each player.
In turns you can do one of these actions: Play a card or discard a card.
You can play Fruit Cards (of the same fruit) to create a fruit tree, Birds to attack another fruit tree, Scarecrows to ward off Birds...
There are special cards such as the Tractor that allows you to play fruit cards of different varieties, the Worm, which you will not like to have at the end of the game and the Firecracker that is the crazy moment of Pajarracos, where you will try to get rid of your Birds to send them to other players.
The game ends when there are no cards left and the fruit trees of each person will be counted. Whoever has scored the most points wins.


Multiply the fun with Pajarracos Party!

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Astronika (アストロニカ)
boardgame.description:
The year is 2061. The Moon Base Development Project. Also known as Astronika.

It's been almost 100 years since the Apollo missions, when humans first set foot on the Moon. The history of the moon is about to be rewritten by mankind. With the development of science and technology, the Moon is no longer an impenetrable territory, but a new frontier within reach.

And it is no longer the nations of the past that are inviting mankind to the Moon. Instead, it is the international space companies, which transcend national boundaries.

Players are the project leaders of an International Space Company. Your mission is to select the "right people", assemble a team and lead the project to success.
Which company will establish a bridgehead in the new frontier of the Moon?

- A medium-weight board game with the theme of developing the moon
- Expansion & Reproduction x Engine Build x Area Majority
- Assemble a diverse crew and build your own team!

—description from the publisher (translated)
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: メリーアンドリューワークス(merry-andrew-works)

boardgame.name: Q-less
boardgame.description:
Use ALL 12 letters to make words that connect.

​

Words must have at least 3 letters.

No proper nouns and/or names.

​

There is no time limit and no scoring.

​

Most rolls are solvable but not all.

If you're not successful, roll again.

boardgame.name: Defenders of the Spring Citadel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Above the high, terraced walls of the city, cloaked in green, pink specks float on the wind. Visitors who had never seen the strange sights of Niddir might comment on the hanging gardens visible from nearly everywhere in the city, or on the strange unnatural hue of the sky. Some might look past the city beyond the cliffside, where a sprawling, bizarre hellscape stretches out before you, contrasting with the lush beauty of this dragonborn garrison."

You have arrived at the flowered gates of Khor, the Spring Citadel, a city of danger and beauty, piety and sin, nobility and poverty. This city has recently thrown open its gates to the rest of the continent of Faerûn, inviting foreigners to explore the winding streets and view the beautiful spring blooms.

However, tourists aren't the only visitors to come to this land of dragons and danger. Adventurers have arrived... as well as those they hunt.

Defenders of the Spring Citadel is a full adventure campaign for 5th edition Dungeons and Dragons, going all the way from 1st to 5th level. This campaign is perfect for a group looking to explore the pulse of a city with a unique flavor and history completely unknown to the larger setting of the Forgotten Realms. In this adventure your players will experience the rhythm of the city, thwart an assassination attempt, raid a smuggling ring, help hunt (or hinder) a bounty, gain the favor of a politician, discover an ancient tomb deep beneath the cobblestones, and, of course, take lots and lots of pictures so they can tell all their friends back home!

Your players can experience all of these and more - if the city doesn't swallow them whole.

boardgame.name: Pale Rider of the Shattered Plains
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"It has been days of travel. Your face is sun-kissed and raw, but your fingers and toes are blue with poor circulation. You feel the wind on your face, and you smell flowers on the breeze, but you look around, and see nothing but mountains, and feel the heaviness of the air pressure. A moment before, you were trudging through a dank swamp, with the slime and algae still sticking to your clothes, and now, you feel cold mountain air and see nothing around you but snow and rocks. This cursed land is nonsense from top to bottom, but you have survived it. You must, or the town is doomed.."

You have been sent on an important mission to the frontier town of Sokkha, stranded among the madness of the Shattered Plains - a land which lacks any natural logic, where environments of every type are packed in and shuffled together. Sokkha has managed to survive, but this latest challenge is even too much for them to handle.

The Pale Rider has appeared. His aims are a mystery. His goals are unknown. The only thing the people of Sokkha knows is that a terrible curse befalls all who cross the path of this vengeful wraith.

Pale Rider of the Shattered Plains is a full adventure campaign for 5th edition Dungeons and Dragons, going all the way from 5th to 10th level, and is the sequel to Defenders of the Spring Citedel. This campaign is excellent for players who wish to explore strange, uncanny fantasy locations, with a rough-and-tumble frontier village as their base of operations. Explorers, hunters, and outlanders will feel right at home surviving the Shattered Plains. In this adventure your players might hunt - or be hunted - by the creatures out in the wilderness, fortify the defenses of the town, settle disputes between neighbors, uncover previously unknown mysteries of this land, and, of course, delve into ancient tombs and burial sites... to undo a previous adventurer's plunder!

Your players can experience all of these and more - if they don't succumb to the curse of the Pale Rider first.

boardgame.name: Mystery of the Missing Head
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"It has been days of travel. Your face is sun-kissed and raw, but your fingers and toes are blue with poor circulation. You feel the wind on your face, and you smell flowers on the breeze, but you look around, and see nothing but mountains, and feel the heaviness of the air pressure. A moment before, you were trudging through a dank swamp, with the slime and algae still sticking to your clothes, and now, you feel cold mountain air and see nothing around you but snow and rocks. This cursed land is nonsense from top to bottom, but you have survived it. You must, or the town is doomed.."

You have been sent on an important mission to the frontier town of Sokkha, stranded among the madness of the Shattered Plains - a land which lacks any natural logic, where environments of every type are packed in and shuffled together. Sokkha has managed to survive, but this latest challenge is even too much for them to handle.

The Pale Rider has appeared. His aims are a mystery. His goals are unknown. The only thing the people of Sokkha knows is that a terrible curse befalls all who cross the path of this vengeful wraith.

Pale Rider of the Shattered Plains is a full adventure campaign for 5th edition Dungeons and Dragons, going all the way from 5th to 10th level, and is the sequel to Defenders of the Spring Citedel. This campaign is excellent for players who wish to explore strange, uncanny fantasy locations, with a rough-and-tumble frontier village as their base of operations. Explorers, hunters, and outlanders will feel right at home surviving the Shattered Plains. In this adventure your players might hunt - or be hunted - by the creatures out in the wilderness, fortify the defenses of the town, settle disputes between neighbors, uncover previously unknown mysteries of this land, and, of course, delve into ancient tombs and burial sites... to undo a previous adventurer's plunder!

Your players can experience all of these and more - if they don't succumb to the curse of the Pale Rider first.

boardgame.name: Temptation of the Demon Ruins
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Something has awakened. Something deep within the earth. It tugs at the corners of your dreams, runs its fingers through your memories, and seems to wander the night, searching for something. What, you ask? Who knows? A purpose? Something it lost? Prey? That’s not for me to say, my friend. All I know is something has begun, and if it isn’t finished soon, we may all pay the price."

Something strange is happening in the small fishing hamlet of Tyra, a sleepy village on the edge of a beautiful lake, with something hidden deep underneath. Something has begun to stalk the villagers at night, and retreats to its unknown den during the day, and now the town's protector, a powerful archmage, has disappeared.

What's more, there are whispers through the town of something happening - something new, exciting, and frightening. Omens, visions, and signs are cropping up, luring all sorts of people to this unassuming village, and something, finally, is about to be born.

Temptation of the Demon Ruins is a full adventure campaign for 5th edition Dungeons and Dragons, going all the way from 15th to 20th level. This campaign is perfect for a high-level adventuring group looking to make a difference in the fabric of the cosmos. You can expect dungeon crawling, demonic incursions, devious mazes, war, a prophesey involving a member of the party, and, ultimately, a choice to be made revolving around the birth of a brand new entity - and the sacrifice which must be made to make that birth possible.

Your players can experience all of these and more - if they can survive!

boardgame.name: Madness of the Misty Cove
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"You enter the cave, jagged walls slick with seawater and made slippery by moss and clinging seaweed. The smell brings to mind the pungent odor of fish and brine, but there is something else as well, something foul and stinking. You walk deeper, the darkness enveloping you as you explore this seaside cavern. That's when you feel it, like teeth in your mind. You are not alone here..."

Welcome to the Mist Crescent, a beautiful jewel of an island in the middle of the sea. It is not drawn on any map, nor will it be found in any ship's log. It seems to be a mirage, all covered in fog, and never seeming to be in the same place twice, but it is real, and you have been invited to salvage the abandoned treasure found in the undersea caves of this oasis in the middle of the sea.

Would that this was all you would find!

boardgame.name: Pregenerated Weirdos
boardgame.description:
Pregens for Eclectic Tastes

Publisher's blurb:

Are you frustrated by boring pre-generated characters? Have you dug through endless sheets of elf wizards, dwarf clerics, halfling rogues, and human fighters before settling on someone boring and functional? Wanna try out some of the WEIRD stuff?

WELL HAVE I GOT A COLLECTION FOR YOU!

boardgame.name: Critical Kiss
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Critical Kiss offers 14 unique romance and action-themed one-shots for parties of varying levels! Adventures range from RP-heavy encounters to action-based based encounters, so there is something for everyone who wants to stab or smooch their way to true love.

boardgame.name: Pugilist
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Savage Worlds RPG release brings you the Pugilist Old West Archetype. This ready-to-go character build presents the fist-flying pugilist, a rough-and-tumble boxer and the hunt for their next prize fight–and other trouble to get into. Includes adding a Pugilism option to the Superior Kung Fu Edge.

boardgame.name: Icaion: Aberration
boardgame.description:
Kickstarter exclusive mini-expansion for Icaion.

The Aberration is a special enemy unit that spawns after a considerable amount of Parasites gathers in one place. It is the evolution of a basic Parasite. It is hostile towards inferior Parasites, and embodies a direct threat to the Seekers as well. It is a real menace in lots of aspects since, when it steps in, here is what you are not allowed to do:

you cannot deploy Machines in its region
you cannot build a Wonder in its region
you cannot extract Qoam in its region
you cannot add Parasites to its region, harming players that follow a "parasite-hunting" strategy

When a Seeker manages to defeat the Aberration the miniature is removed from the game (for now) and points are scored by the Seeker.

boardgame.name: Arcana Domain: Rebalanced
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"With snout buried in a book and mind brimming with possibilities, the Cleric ponders the nature of the weave. They commune with their god, and through them are granted magical prowess far beyond that of their peers."

The Arcana Domain, introduced in the Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide, is a cleric domain in 5th edition D&D which focuses on wizardly might and knowledge over other, more pious pursuits. Their domain is magic itself, and they draw power from the gods of knowledge and magic to burn their enemies and to push the boundaries of arcane knowledge.

While the Arcana Domain is a fun idea, it is rarely played, and has joined the Battlerager and Purple Dragon Knight in the small pile of obscure, low-powered classes found in the Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide that have been neither reprinted, alongside the likes of the Storm Sorcerer and Sun Soul Monk, or revamped, like the noble Bladesinger.

With that in mind, here is one version of what a revamped Arcana Cleric might be like, released to coincide with Strixhaven: Curriculum of Chaos. This is largely a new subclass based on the officially published version, and for all of the flavor and lore surrounding the Arcana Domain, one should still look up the original version of this class found in the Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide.

boardgame.name: It's Llamatch!
boardgame.description:
Inspired by the most known dating apps, It's Llamatch! is an agile and easy-going card game where only the boldest llama will be able to find its perfect Llamatch! Because dating... is a game!

Scroll through different profiles, read their bios and have a laugh chatting with them. Don't forget to turn on notifications!
Hopefully you'll draw your favourite llama's attention.

Start by taking a Profile card that indicates what you are looking for in your Llamatch!: Sexiness, romance, awareness or coolness.

Display four llamatch! cards in front of each player, facing down.

Now explore your Llamatch! Each one gives you different values for each stat.
Check if they fit with your preferences.
No? Next!
Yes? Then Slide right and play your cards right:

Use Bio and Chat cards to modify stats, change the rules of the game with each Notification and sabotage other players.

When any player is left with no llamatch! cards in the pile, the game ends.

Get the highest score so you and your date have the best chemistry. Only then we can really say It's Llamatch!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Eldryn: A Union of Elf and Dryad (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Answer the Call of the Forest

Inside, you’ll find a new ancestry for use in your Pathfinder Second Edition Roleplaying Game. The eldryn is a cross between elf and dryad which draws on the powers of nature and internal mystical energy to defeat their opponents and overcome challenges.

boardgame.name: Summon Guardians
boardgame.description:
Summon Guardians is a 2-4 player war strategy board game. It combines the spirit of fantasy and adventure with strategic castle warfare. Players join an epic, centuries-old war for the realm of Quadrenna. Here, four Kingdoms battle over a centrally located territory known as the Wastelands. The main Battlefield of this war is the intersection of these Kingdoms, where each struggles to prevent the other from achieving victory.

Through their Queens, the four Kingdoms summon Guardians from throughout time and around the galaxy in an attempt to gain control of the Wastelands. The Kingdoms’ main tools for winning the war are their two Guardians, each of which has unique strengths and weaknesses. Although the Guardians’ attitudes about being summoned vary, they all loyally serve their Kingdoms and find high honor in their duty.

Each turn consists of 3 phases, in this order: Move, Card, and Action. The Move and Action phases are optional, but the Card phase is required. Both Guardians act during each phase; you can choose the order in which your Guardians act.

A Kingdom achieves victory when it obtains ownership of the Wastelands. This is achieved one of three ways: kill all enemy Guardians, kill all enemy Kings, or take ownership of the Red Jewel Platform in the center by sacrificing 5 Red Jewels to it after your Kingdom is fully Upgraded.

boardgame.name: School of the Sufficiently Advanced
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Screw magic! The inventor has better things to do than mess about with incantations and magic words! A real inventor works in grease and machinery! A true engineer gets their hands dirty. The School of the Sufficiently Advanced may be the school for you.

The School of the Sufficiently Advanced is a new Wizard School for 5th Edition Dungeons and Dragons that allows you to create devices to mimic the use of spellcasting, which you and eventually your allies can use to turn the tide of battle!

If you want to play with magic without using magic, this is the class for you.

boardgame.name: Isle of Trains: All Aboard
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the Isle of Trains, where you are the conductor, and constructor of one of the island’s locomotives. You’ll build trains and load a range of goods to complete contracts across the island, and also deliver passengers to their destinations.

Isle of Trains: All Aboard is a card-based engine building game where cards have multiple uses: You can use cards as locomotives, freight cars, passenger cars, or buildings to improve the effectiveness and abilities of your train. Cards can also be spent to pay for the construction of your new train cars and buildings, or you can use your cards as cargo and load them onto available freight cars.

You will also have a range of passengers who want to be taken to different destinations. You will draw these passengers at random from a bag when you build passenger cars and certain locomotives. You can then load passengers into any available passenger car. When passengers are delivered to their destinations, they will give you an instant powerful bonus!

Loading cargo and passengers into opponents’ trains is important on the Isle of Trains as it’ll also gain you extra bonuses that turn! But this will help the other train conductors get a little closer to completing their goals, by giving them the cargo or passengers, which they can then use for deliveries and big end game points!

The game ends when a certain number of contracts have been completed, or a certain number of passengers are delivered. You win by scoring the most points, which you earn by building up your train, completing contracts, and delivering passengers.

Isle of Trains: All Aboard is all about balancing the need to upgrade your train, with loading cargo or passengers onto opponent’s train for big bonuses, and delivering cargo and passengers to their destinations before anyone else. Build your engine effectively enough to be remembered as the greatest train conductor on the Isle of Trains!

boardgame.name: The Way of Overwhelming Force
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

To bend like the willow is all well and good, but when push comes to shove, would you not rather stand like a mountain? Would you not rather crush like a boulder?

The Way of Overwhelming Force is a new Monk tradition for 5th Edition Dungeons and Dragons that allows you to put the full power of your entire body into your strikes, allows you to break stone and steel with ease, and hardens your skin such that nothing can touch you. Who needs finesse when you have raw power?

The Way of Overwhelming Force is a Strength-based, offensive-focused Monk subclass based around pushing out as much damage with your unarmed strikes as possible, and in breaking the bodies of your opponents utterly.

boardgame.name: The Wager
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

One night, perhaps you found yourself on a crossroad at midnight, and a well-dressed gentleman offered you untold riches, if only you play a little game. You knew this man was not quite human, but the temptation was too much, and you accepted.

Congratulations! You are now the victim and/or beneficiary of The Wager. A new type of Warlock Patron that seeks to gather followers not by making a pact, but by tricking Warlocks into giving up their souls in dark bargains. You still have access to all the power and prestige of a Warlock, but your powers are at your Patron's whim even more than usual, and when you die, your soul is forfeit.

The Wager is a Warlock Patron for players who wish that Warlocks had a more harrowing relationship with their Patrons. It features a Borrowed Time system where your tricky Patron can cause Wild Magic Surge-like effects on you, but if you appease your patron well, you can learn to control the arrival and appearance of these effects.

boardgame.name: The Professor
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Professor!

Scholars, weary teachers, eternal students. The Professor comes in many forms, all of whom are connected by two traits; the search for deeper knowledge, and the urge to pass what they know on to the next generation. For a professor, the pen truly is mightier than the sword or spell, as in their hands the fruits of knowledge borne from a pen may make the sword stroke stronger or may make the spell more potent.

The Professor is defined by their ability to support the party via Treatises - manuals and essays written by the professor and given to other members of their party which the recipient can then read and gain long-term buffs - and their extreme skill with ability checks. They get a large amount of Expertises, and have the unique trait of learning new skills as they level up through class features. They may also function as healers, and as they do not use magic, their abilities are not suppressed by abilities which confound mages and clerics. They may not pack much of a punch in combat, but they more than make up for it by acting as the backbone of the party, eventually giving everyone a permanant ability score increase at level 20!

Alongside this Full, 20-level class, there are five Scholarly Pursuits you can take to further define your genius.

boardgame.name: Revelry Domain
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Priests, Clerics, and other holy leaders have many duties within their holy work. Clerics have long been shepherds of the dead, protectors of the faithful, or keepers of godly knowledge. However, there is one very important function which has been long neglected.

The Revelry Cleric is jolly, in love with life, drink, and always up for a good party. They are the adherents of Gods and Goddesses of the field and the tavern, or the stewards of feast days, weddings, funerals, naming days, and any other time where people come together as a community. These adventurers have been tasked with spreading joy wherever they go, and have the unique ability among all Clerics in D&D to turn water into wine, ensuring that wherever the Revelry Cleric goes, there will be a good time!

You will smash monsters, and you will get smashed, and it will be good.

This Cleric Domain for D&D 5e is a healing and party-support focused Cleric domain, themed around getting absolutely soused. Have fun!

boardgame.name: Oathbreakers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

To fall is merely to rise again.

A Paladin's oath is sacred, and to go against that oath creates a void which must be filled by something. The Oathbreaker still amasses power, but twisted by his betrayal of his Oath. He is powerful, but at a cost, and there is more than one way to fall...

Included in this document are FIVE new Paladin subclasses, each one representing an alternate path a Paladin might take after betraying their oath and falling from grace. Paladins need not necessarily fall to evil, either! A Paladin might stray from Evil, or from Law, or from Chaos, or from any axis on the alignment chart.

boardgame.name: Kobold Stack
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Consider the Kobold
Small, light, largely weak, but when they work together they can be a mighty force – or at least a moderate force. The humble kobold on their own can be powerful of course, as kobold adventurers have proven time and time again, but they are the exceptions. Many Kobolds have to rely even more on teamwork than they already do, and when these kobolds go out into the world, they form a kobold stack.

Kobold stacks are a group of three kobolds who have decided that they have had enough of living in caves or as the minions of cults or dragons and have decided to strike out on their own. Individually, they aren’t remotely strong enough to survive, but together, they are the equal of exactly one adventurer!

boardgame.name: The Hivemaster
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Feel that prickle on your skin? The buzz of wings in your ear? That itch scuttling across your foot? What if you were the master of that feeling? What if you were the ruler of the hive, and had the power to send a cloud of loyal insects to overwhelm your enemies?

There exist a conclave of rangers - Beastmasters, technically, but ones who have claimed dominion over a separate animal kingdom - who care little for those with fur or fang. They prefer instead gossamer wings, thick mandibles, venomous bites, and painful stings. They respect nature at the smallest level. After all, with no bees, wasps, flies, or ants, the trees and plants could not live, and without the plants, the animals would die. They consider theirs the most precious corner of nature, and will protect it with their lives if necessary.

The Hivemaster is a variation on the Beastmaster Archetype which allows for the use of a Swarm of Insects as a Beast Companion, and includes many unique abilities depending on which insects you choose to befriend.

Included are two versions of the Hivemaster, one appropriate for the basic Ranger class found in the PHB, and one appropriate for the Revised Ranger released through Unearthed Arcana. Both are functional, and will be a good addition to any game.

If you love creepy crawlies, this is the class for you. Have fun!

boardgame.name: Dragons & Dragons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's in the title of the game! It's half of what drew a lot of people to play this game we all play, and now, you can share in the power and the majesty of these mythical beasts that we so often seek to battle, befriend, or destroy!

This is a collection of 12 NEW SUBCLASS OPTIONS for you or your players to use in your games. Would you like to be a worshiper of Dragonkind and follow the divine Dragon Domain for clerics? Would you rather gain power from a draconic patron and invoke the Ancient Dragon Patron for Warlocks? Perhaps you are simply a bard obsessed with the College of Dragon Lore or you're a Ranger who found an injured Wyrmling in the woods and decided to follow the path of the Dragonheart Archetype.

boardgame.name: Dragons & Dragons Expanded
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Do the screeches of jungle birds and the incessant hum of exotic insects give you a thrill? Does the search for new and interesting creatures sound like your calling in life? Imagine, if you will, if those birds were the size of houses – if those insects had jaws that could swallow you whole. Sound exciting? Running towards such dangerous, mythological beasts is the calling of any Professor worth his salt when they have taken Mythozoology as their Scholarly Pursuit!

Learn more about monsters, learn to communicate with them, see their weaknesses, their strengths, and perhaps even befriend a few along the way.

boardgame.name: Bloodstone
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

The city of Heliwyr is damned. Decades ago, a mad priest officiated an ancient ritual, awakening a wicked force that branded every inhabitant, corrupting their blood. On nights with a blood moon, the curse awakens, depriving the inhabitants of their minds. Those who decide to follow the path of the priest, voluntarily feeding on the corrupt blood of people, become Apostles: almost immortal creatures, with bestial features, devoid of any humanity.

Bloodstone is an action-packed horror tabletop roleplaying game with a dark, gothic feel.
The players are a group of hunters, sent to the city of Heliwyr on a blood moon night, to hunt down an Apostle who is attempting to ascend, opening a gateway to the realm of the Ancients.

The game has a high pace: the Hunt is a race against the clock.
Bloodstone is designed for one-shot games: every time we play, we play different Hunters, who will face new obstacles and challenges every time: the blood moon nights in Heliwyr never end.

Dual Pamphlet Game

The GM pamphlet (Game Master's Scroll) features most of the rules for running the game, the setting, and adventures sparks.
The Player pamphlet (Hunter's Scroll) is the character sheet itself and it contains character creation and other character-specific rules.


Streamlined Forged in the Dark Rules
Because the game is action-oriented, the Blades in the Dark ruleset is revised and compacted:


A Stamina System inspired by the souls-like games, like Dark Souls and Bloodborne, instead of the stress system.
Character Creation is done by answering a bunch of questions: in 1 minute you can start playing the game.
No Playbooks: each hunter is differentiated by their origin, their attire style, and their weapons.
Only three attributes: prowess, resolve, and wit.
Special actions to summon ghosts from other worlds and visit the Workshop, a place between the nightmare and the dream.

boardgame.name: Chronomancer
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A man out of time. A traveler through the timestream. A controller of destiny. Do these sound like you? The Chronomancer is a brand new bloodline for Sorcerers, who specialize in controlling the speed and flow of time, including the flow of the battlefield itself. Initiative and reactions are mere toys to a skilled Chronomancer, and a true master of time may be able to use the enemy's own Time Magic against them.

Included is not only the Chronomancer, but also a selection of unique spells designed to be taken by all spellcasting classes. There is one spell per spell level, including a cantrip.

Take the time stream in your hands. Become a master of the clock. Try a Chronomancer for your next Sorcerer.

boardgame.name: Ascendant Domain
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

While most Clerics follow the domain of a God, you have chosen a different path. Why worship a God when you could become one? They have perhaps called you mad. Unhinged. Insane. But you did not listen. Something has awakened inside of you, something small, and weak, but still something. The spark inside of you is tiny – merely a mote of divinity – but still, it is enough. You know now your destiny. All you have to do is reach out and grasp it!

The Ascendant Domain is a new subclass for Clerics in D&D 5e. It has a weaker start, as you are unsupported by any existing God of your world, but eventually you will become powerful enough to cast spells more often, and even confer a part of your power onto your followers and create clerics of your own.

boardgame.name: Tabaxi Racial Options
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tabaxi are a mysterious and oft-misunderstood race of creatures. With unclear origins, far-away roots, and tight lips about the lands they have come from, it is often difficult to suss out more than we already know about them.

Enter this handy field guide! Within the pages of this article, you will find additional information on Tabaxi, as well as the introduction of three new subraces, as the author explores Chult and beyond to track down those blessed by the Cat Lord. Also in this guide is an unexpected, Rakshasa-themed Tiefling variant, for those of fiendish blood who wish to pass as your furry bretheren.

boardgame.name: Demi-Dragon Racial Option
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Rendered almost invisible by misunderstandings, discrimination, and ignorance, the Demi-Dragon is a hybrid race which arises whenever a Dragonborn mates with either a Lizardfolk, Tortle, or Kobold, creating a unique creature which smoothly blends traits from both of their parents. This race was completely unknown for many years, and have only recently been recognized as something distinct from either of their parents, to stand beside Half-Elves and Half-Orcs. Still, ignorance about these rare people still runs wild.

Enter this handy field guide! Within the pages of this article, you will find additional information on Demi-Dragons, as well as their three possible subraces, as the author explores the Sword Coast to track down examples of the differing permutations of this race, and to understand something about a few of their parent races as well.

boardgame.name: Gnolls!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Conquering Hunger. Laughing Death. The Children of Yeenoghu. These are some of the names that have been given to Gnolls over the years. They are known across the Realms as violent, sadistic, fiendish, chaotic forces of evil who should never be trusted. But is that truly the end of the story?

There is evil in Gnoll-kind, that is clear, but even in the deepest depths of evil, wouldn't it be nice if there was just a small ray of hope?

boardgame.name: Battlemap Gate
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Battlemap Gate is 35 x 25 in 70 pixels per inch.

boardgame.name: Battlemap Road
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Battlemap Road is 35 x 45 in 70 pixels per inch.

boardgame.name: Battlemap River Fork
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Battlemap River Fork is 49x41 in 70 pixels per inch.

boardgame.name: Battlemap City Street
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Battlemap City Street is 45 x 35 in 70 pixels per inch.

boardgame.name: Battlemap Airport
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Battlemap Airport is 139 x 129 in 70 pixels per inch.

boardgame.name: La Notte Eterna Quickstart Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nebvarasa is wracked by the Celestial War. The worlds are under siege by the gods and their powerful armies. Laon, god of the sun, was imprisoned and Neir has fallen under eternal darkness. Meteors in the shape of angels, demons and artifacts fall on the land, spreading chaos among mortals.

La Notte Eterna 5e is an epic-fantasy setting created by author Jason R. Forbus. The project was started more than 15 years ago and over the years has grown with new ideas, game mechanics, updates, edits and improvements. The setting currently comprises of a core manual of over 300 pages, a monster manual that adds dozens of new creatures and mechanics, a collection of short stories based in the world of Neir offering ideas for new quests and characters, and an adventure to get you started in La Notte Eterna 5e (Creeping Death).

This QuickStart Guide has been designed to provide all the elements necessary to start exploring and playing La Notte Eterna 5e. It includes three new playable races, two paths, a summary description of the kingdoms and of the gods as well as a one-shot adventure and a link to download the character’s sheet and a battlemap.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: La Notte Eterna Quick Start Guide 2.0

boardgame.name: Echt Spitze
boardgame.description:
In Echt Spitze, you want to fill the spaces on your player sheet — both sides of it! — to score more points than anyone else.

To play, each player takes a sheet from the score pad of the same level (1-3). The sheet has a 5x5 grid of squares on each side, with the rows and columns being numbered 1-5. Many of the spaces feature an icon (fruit, flower, gem, etc.) surrounded by a soap bubble.

The active player rolls 4-6 dice, two more than the player count, then all players in turn choose one of the dice and place it on the matching number in either the row or column of their sheet. (Dice show 1-5 and a ?, which is a joker.) The active player then either keeps the remaining two dice or re-rolls them. Each player can then use one of the two common dice to target a particular space on their score sheet, e.g., if you placed a 4 on the 4 column and the two dice show 1 and 3, you then mark off either the 1-4 space or the 3-4 space on your sheet.

If this space has a soap bubble, you mark off this space, poke a hole in it with your pencil, then flip the sheet over and mark off the newly poked space. Now you'll continue play on the back of your sheet, flipping it over again only when you "pop" another soap bubble.

When you mark off an icon, no matter which side of the paper, track this in your score column. The first player to mark off all icons of a type receives the large bonus, then everyone else can score only the small bonus for this icon.

One or both of your chosen dice might have an X on them. If this is the case and you don't pop a bubble this turn, you can mark off one or two extra spaces adjacent to the originally marked space for that turn. With two Xs, if you marked 1-4, for example, then you could mark 1-5 and 2-5. If you mark all squares in a row or column, circle the star next to that line.

When someone scores their third type of icon, the game ends. Players tally their icon bonuses, points for each star (which vary per level), and 1 point for each collected icon that didn't receive a bonus. Whoever has the highest score wins.

Level 2 sheets have beehives, and when you mark off a beehive, the bees attack everyone else and they can no longer mark off this space, which means they can't complete this row and column. Level 3 sheets challenge you to create polyominoes with marked-out spaces, in addition to collecting icons.

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 1 bis 4 Spieler Spieldauer: 20 Minuten Altersempfehlung: ab 8 Jahre
Echt Spitze Nach dem Knüller KANNSTE KNICKEN wird die erfolgreiche Roll & Write-Serie vom bekannten Autorenpaar Klaus-Jürgen Wrede und Ralph Querfurt wieder mit einer pfiffigen Besonderheit fortgesetzt.
In ECHT SPITZE muss durch das Blatt durchgestochen werden, um auf die Ziele auf der Rückseite des Blattes zu gelangen. Als Gimmick dient ein Gummipad. Ein tolles Spielvergnügen!
✓ Familienspiel/ Roll & Write-Spiel mit Durchstechen des Blattes ✓ Fortgesetzt von KANNSTE KNICKEN ✓ Moosgummipad als Gimmick ✓ 3 verschiedene Level ✓ Fortführung der Klein & Fein Reihe
Inhalt: 6 Würfel 1 Unterlage 1 Schreibblock 4 Bleistifte 1 Spielanleitung

Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE
Title: Echt Spitze (DE) Publisher: Schmidt Spiele Language(s): German

boardgame.name: Jurassic World: Rückkehr zur Isla Nublar
boardgame.description:
Isla Nublar, the setting for Jurassic Park films, was largely destroyed by a volcanic eruption. Many dinosaurs and some of the research results could not be recovered while people were escaping this disaster.

Now in Rückkehr zur Isla Nublar ("Return to Isla Nubar"), a small brave group is trying to save what can be saved. To do this, the players set up new observation posts to secure existing knowledge. The dinosaurs, in turn, are trying to save their own lives and (understandably) they have little leniency for the players' efforts.

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 4 Spieler Spieldauer: 60 Minuten Altersempfehlung: ab 10 Jahre
Jurassic World: Rückkehr zur Isla Nublar Nach einem Vulkanausbruch waren die Betreiber von Jurassic World gezwungen, die Isla Nublar zu verlassen. Bei dieser Flucht konnten nur ein kleiner Teil der Dinosaurier und Materialien gerettet werden. Ihr verkörpert ein kleines Team von Wissenschaftlern, das auf die Insel geschickt wird, um einige der zurück gelassenen Forschungsergebnisse zu retten. Auf der Insel angekommen, stellt ihr fest, dass die Natur sich ihre Insel zurückerobert hat. Die ehemaligen Forschungs- und Parkanlagen sind teilweise verfallen und anhaltende Vulkanausbrüche erschweren die Bergung der zurückgelassenen Materialen. Um Erfolg bei eurer Mission zu haben, müsst ihr eure Ausrüstung geschickt einsetzen und Zugang zu neuen Ressourcen erlangen. Doch bleibt niemals zu lange an einem Ort. Denn hier kommt ein weiterer entscheidender Faktor ins Spiel: Die verbliebenen Dinosaurier haben sich ausgebreitet und werden die Insel nicht mit euch teilen wollen. Seid ihr bereit für euer Abenteuer?
✓ Familienspiel ✓ Thematisch passend zur Filmreihe ✓ Denkbuilding kombiniert mit Brettspiel ✓ Zusätzlich mit Gameplay Video (Erklärvideo)
Inhalt: 1 Spielplan 4 Dinosaurierfiguren 36 Camps 24 Ausrüstungskisten 20 Dinosaurierkarten 40 Startkarten 42 Aktionskarten 18 Wertungskarten 1 Startmarker 20 Entwicklungsplättchen 1 Spielregel

Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

boardgame.name: Clash at Kell Crenn
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An original level 6-8 adventure made for D&D 5e.

A river journey takes the adventurers to the besieged river-fort of Kell Crenn, where a gnoll horde assails the walls throughout the long night. What are the wasteland raiders seeking in the frontier trade post?

boardgame.name: The Pool Below
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A group of three teenagers disappeared recently. They all recently came of age, and the town guards merely assume they ran off to seek fame and fortune. The parents of the missing children are skeptical, and fear something more sinister has happened.

Additionally, the deacon of an old, burned out temple devoted to magic and portents is hiding a secret. Even though the temple is assumed to be defunct, an evil priest named Shukan is operating out of a secret chamber located in the temple’s basement. Shukan has connected a magical portal to the temple’s baptismal pool, turning the font into a gateway to hell and terror.

boardgame.name: The Pool Below
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A group of three teenagers disappeared recently. They all recently came of age, and the town guards merely assume they ran off to seek fame and fortune. The parents of the missing children are skeptical, and fear something more sinister has happened.

Additionally, the deacon of an old, burned out temple devoted to magic and portents is hiding a secret. Even though the temple is assumed to be defunct, an evil priest named Shukan is operating out of a secret chamber located in the temple’s basement. Shukan has connected a magical portal to the temple’s baptismal pool, turning the font into a gateway to hell and terror.

boardgame.name: Critical Role: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting Reborn
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Welcome to Tal'Dorei, a fantasy-filled continent brimming with grand tales of heroes and adventure - and eagerly awaiting your own epic stories. Soar on a skyship from the metropolis of Emon to the distant haven of Whitestone, venture into wilderness rife with terrifying monsters and wayward mages, and uncover magic items that range from simple trinkets to the legendary Vestiges of Divergence.

boardgame.name: Blood and Snow
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dr. Jackie Amundsen, a researcher who claims to specialize in gigant anthropology, calls the Fated to Fortune Falls. Winter’s chill is setting over Malifaux, and the doctor believes now is the time when the legendary Modranicht ceremony will be performed. The only problem is, the gigants who practice it dwell high in the Far Peaks. The Fated will need to bundle up and collect evidence of the mysterious Fae as they trek up the snowy cliffs. Jackie Amundsen’s studies might not be as ridiculous as everyone thinks…

boardgame.name: Horrors of the Blighted Woods
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The blighted woods, as their name indicate, are forests and jungles that slowly got corrupted by the influence of the Blight. As such they are not safe for traveling, unless a creature is already under the influence of the Blight, in which case the dangerous woods become a warm home instead.

boardgame.name: Crash of Thunder: Napoleon at Austerlitz 1805
boardgame.description: "Crash of Thunder: Napoleon at Austerlitz 1805" is a fast and easy wargame of the Battle of Austerlitz in 1805. One player commands the French Army of Napoleon and the other the Allied Army (Russian and Austrian). Each side tries try to win the battle by inflicting casualties and breaking the morale of their opponent. The combat abilities of each corps or formation as they historically performed in the battle are listed on its own Formation Card. Each Formation card represents a varying number of units that are placed on the map of the battlefield of Austerlitz. There are also tactics cards that reflect actual events of the battle, that each side may use in order to increase their chances of success in each attack or defense. The Game consists of each side taking turns by declaring an action to activate one card each turn.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Forgetting Fablerise
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

While Prismeer is far from the only Domain of Delight within the multiverse, rarely do these realms cross paths. When Fablerise collides with Thither, blurring the border between their worlds, some might find themselves on a brand new adventure, while others may just find they’re lost within their own.

As the party, potentially unwittingly, enters Fablerise, they stumble upon storytime with its archfey, Yarnspinner. After hearing a riveting tale about Valor’s Call and the League of Malevolence, the party is left to rest for the night. While they sleep, they experience vivid dreams, only to awaken having forgotten their names by one of Yarnspinner’s corrupted ghosts! In order to get them back, the party must join forces with a mysterious orc in the same predicament as their own. Together, the allies will infiltrate Yarnspinner’s Scriptorium, find his novel-in-progress, and recover their names before they can escape Fablerise and return to Prismeer. During their escape, the party may come face to face with one of the corrupted ghosts.

User summary:

This adventure is based on the contents of chapter 3 in The Wild Beyond the Witchlight.

boardgame.name: Inside Slanty Tower
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

One never quite knows what to expect when they enter the Feywild. When a hot air balloon flies across the sky and crashes into a tower tipping in the swampy ground, even the most epic heroes may wonder, “What in the world is going on?” In order to get to the bottom of it all, the heroes must first reach the top of Slanty Tower and save a faerie dragon knight with vital information about Prismeer. Will the heroes find a way to save him or lose themselves in the swamp?

User summary:

This adventure is based on the contents of chapter 2 in The Wild Beyond the Witchlight.

boardgame.name: The Cloistered Cove
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Will of the Feywild, Leader of the Getaway Gang, is believed by some to be the liberator of Thither. With a warm heart and hidden haven, Will saves lost children from the clutches of Skabatha Nightshade. However, Will’s dark prologue and true identity is a history known to very few. When his past comes back to haunt Will’s present, what will the heroes make of the future?

User summary:

This adventure is based on the contents of chapter 3 in The Wild Beyond the Witchlight.

boardgame.name: The Floating Isles
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Thither suffers at the hands of Skabatha Nightshade, withering from the doom and decay eating at its core. The rot continues to spread, poisoning the land, and where Skabatha’s presence is not enough to disrupt Thither’s inhabitants, the hag turns to her minions to carry out her ill will. Unsullied land in this slice of Prismeer is fading fast, and the few plots that remain untouched are in high demand. Desperate for a safe place to live, all of Thither’s creatures – from the smallest pixies to the hulking jabberwock – flock to these remaining havens. As such, even the fey not yet corrupted have begun to turn on one another, slinging insults, spells, and arrows in their fight for a new home. Will the heroes be able to navigate these conflicts as the dung hits the fan?

User summary:

This adventure is based on the contents of chapter 3 in The Wild Beyond the Witchlight.

boardgame.name: The Watcher's Pool
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Mystery abounds in the fantastical Feywild where evil things lurk, strange things are at work, and what’s real -- may be -- quite absurd. The locals believe the secrets of Prismeer can only be pierced by a fabled antlered serpent, known as the Watcher. Unfortunately, much has changed since the Hourglass Coven took over. While the Watcher still resides in its cave, they now find themself alone, tormented by the coven’s minions. Will the heroes find guidance from this curious creature, or be forever stuck in the swampy mire?

User summary:

This adventure is based on the contents of chapter 2 in The Wild Beyond the Witchlight.

boardgame.name: Within Brigands' Tollway
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A bramble in the foot of those who cross the swampy bog of Hither, Agdon Longscarf and his notorious brigands have been living large beneath Bavlorna Blightstraw. Few outside of his harengon crew have seen the inside of Brigands' Tollway, where Agdon is the king of thieves, surrounded by the riches of those he's robbed. Fewer still are privy to his wild ambitions of moving up and out from under the thumb of his mistress. What threads might our heroes unwind on their journey to Brigands' Tollway?

User summary:

This adventure is based on the contents of chapter 2 in The Wild Beyond the Witchlight.

boardgame.name: Out of the Abyss: The Fall of Cyrog
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Deep in the Underdark, an elder brain Cyrog has died and been reanimated by the Demon Prince of Undeath, Orcus. Brave adventurers will be called upon to help vanquish this evil. Should they fail, Cyrog and all of his mind flayers will be able to create an army for Orcus to unleash destruction upon the Underdark and the world.

In this supplement to Out of the Abyss, your party will explore the lair of an elder brain named Cyrog (aluded to in the official adventure, but never fleshed out). The adventure hooks are primarily linked to Out of the Abyss, but the story may be run as a standalone adventure as well. The adventure contains opportunities for roleplay, exploration, and combat.

boardgame.name: Bilberry Patch
Blåbärsstället
Mustikkapaikka
boardgame.description:
An easy and atmospheric board game with a little tactics for the whole family.

Bilberry Patch is an easy game with a little tactics for the whole family. The best pickers know that speed does not always equal a full basket when picking berries: the best patches reveal themselves to those who take their time in the forest!

Players roll dice and move around a circular board, collecting bilberries on spaces with special icons. Action cards and magic branches add an extra element of excitement to the game. The object is to collect as much bilberries as possible during one round.

At the end, the players count their bilberries and the player with the biggest haul wins the game.

Includes rules in Finnish, Swedish and English.

boardgame.name: Die Zukunft von Camelot
boardgame.description:
Camelot is preparing once again to search for the Holy Grail, and King Arthur and his closest confidante, Merlin, have come up with a plan to combine the strengths of knighthood and magic. They will send out teams consisting of a Knight of the Round Table and one of Merlin's apprentices, and together with a small entourage, the groups will complete various challenges.

Whether in the countryside or at Camelot's court, whether in jousting or uncovering hidden mysteries, knights and mages in Die Zukunft von Camelot ("The Future of Camelot") must work closely together to ensure their success and perhaps actually deliver the grail to their king when they return home.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Monstersuppe
boardgame.description:
Real monsters are always hungry! They love to eat a homemade and freshly prepared monster soup, ideally one that contains very special ingredients in their delicious broth: a stinky sock, for example, or a freshly caught fish bone, topped off by a slender candy cane.

Which one of you will be the first to ﬁnd all the ingredients you are looking for in Monstersuppe? Whoever has the most slime cubes in their soup after four rounds wins.

—description from the publisher

Monstersuppe Richtige Monster sind immer hungrig! Am allerliebsten verspeisen sie eine selbstgemachte und frisch zubereitete Monstersuppe. ln ihre leckere Bouillon werfen sie dabei einige ganz besondere Zutaten: zum Beispiel eine saubere Stinkesocke oder eine fangfrische Fischgräte, am Ende abgeschmeckt mit einer zarten Zuckerstange. Da kann man wirklich nur sagen: guten Appetit!
Spielziel: Wer von euch findet zuerst alle gesuchten Zutaten für eine köstliche Monstersuppe? Die unterschiedlichen Zutaten befinden sich in euren Fühlbeuteln, in denen ihr sie möglichst schnell erfühlen sollt. Für jede richtig ertastete Zutat gibt es am Ende einer Runde einen zusätzlichen Schleimwürfel in eure Monstersuppe – mmmh, da wird die Suppe ja noch leckerer! Wer nach vier Runden die meisten Schleimwürfel in seiner Suppe hat, gewinnt das Spiel.

boardgame.name: Oath of the Seelie Court
boardgame.description:
"The Oath of the Seelie Court is sworn to by paladins that stand as champions of the unseen realms of the feywild.

Where other paladins hold to orderly ideals like truth, justice, or law, Seelie Court paladins follow the more chaotic ideals of beauty, passion, and status. For them, all the world is a court, and they will use gladly use deception and other forms of persuasions to tell a more beautiful truth – or to further their own ideals, ends, andgoals."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Die Villa der Vampire
boardgame.description:
The big vampire festival, which takes place every 99 years, is coming up in the abandoned villa. But what's this? The very old vampires are still "sleeping" calmly in their coffins and they might miss out. You can't have that!

In Die Villa der Vampire, you slip into the role of child vampires, and with the help of three vampire bats, try to maneuver garlic bulbs into suitable graves in the vampire villa to wake up the old vampires. But where exactly are the well-heeled vampires who will bring a lot of vampire points hiding? Who will use skill and luck to collect the most vampire points and win?

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 4 Spieldauer: 15 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 5+
Drei Magier®: Die Villa der Vampire Auf geht’s zum munteren Knollen-Rollen! In der verlassenen Villa steht das große Vampirfest an, welches alle 99 Jahre dort stattfindet. Aber was ist das? Die hochbetagten Vampire „pennen“ noch seelenruhig in ihren Särgen. Ihr schlüpft in die Rolle der Kindervampire und versucht, mithilfe von drei Vampir-Fledermäusen, die Knoblauch-Knollen in passende Gräber der Vampir-Villa zu bugsieren und so die alten Vampire aufzuwecken. Aber wo genau haben sich eigentlich die wohlbetuchten Vampire versteckt, die viele Vampirpunkte bringen? Wer von euch sammelt mit Geschick und einer Portion Glück die meisten Vampirpunkte und gewinnt am Ende das Spiel?
Vampirtipp für junge und kleine Vampire: Spielt am besten auf einem niedrigen Tisch – oder vielleicht sogar auf dem Boden!
In der Villa der Vampire geht es turbulent zur Sache: Da werden Knoblauch-Knollen in die Gräber der dösenden Vampire geschubst, um diese rechtzeitig fürs große Vampirfest zu wecken. Denn was verabscheuen Vampire bekanntlich am meisten? Ist doch klar: Knoblauch! Und wusstet ihr schon: in den rechteckigen Gräbern schlummern meistens die Vampire, die nicht so viele Vampirpunkte bringen. Im hinteren Teil der Villa, in den teuren Prunksärgen, da dösen die wohlbetuchten Vampire! Wer von euch am Ende die meisten Vampirpunkte gesammelt hat, gewinnt dieses vampirstarke Spiel.
Inhalt: 3 Knoblauch-Knollen 1 Würfel Villa mit 3 Fußböden 1 Sanduhr 3 Vampir-Fledermäuse 1 Dach 41 Grabsteine 3 Villa-Türme 1 Gräfin Eckzahn (= zweiteilige Steckfigur) 1 Graf Knolle (= zweiteilige Steckfigur)

boardgame.name: Super Tricks
boardgame.description:
A trick-taking card game.

First, draw cards from the deck, or from the face-up card next to it, until you reach the hand size limit.
Then, the player must place at least 1 card from their hand onto the board. During your turn, you may play up to all cards in your hand. If you "Recycle" a card from a captured super trick you also play it, in addition to the cards from your hand.

Eventually you will run out of cards to draw from the deck - then players stop drawing but still must lay down at least 1 card per turn until their hands are empty. At this point, cards on each players side are automatically captured by those players. The cards left in the middle remain neutral. Count up your captured cards, and whoever has more is the winner.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Batman: Everybody Lies
Batman: Wszyscy Kłamią
boardgame.description:
Batman: Everybody Lies is a crime-solving deduction game for 2-4 players set in rich lore of the Batman comics universe. Players take on the roles of four key investigators – instinctive journalist Warren Spacey, tenacious reporter Vicki Vale, brutish detective Harvey Bullock, or the cunning Catwoman – who are drawn into a series of mysterious events unfolding in Gotham City.

Throughout the game, players cooperatively make decisions running the investigation and trying to solve a series of challenging cases. They visit famous locations in Gotham City (like the Batcave, Arkham Asylum, Blackgate Penitentiary, and the Gotham City Gazette) and cross paths with well-known Batman characters (like Batman, The Penguin, Poison Ivy, Mr. Freeze, Scarecrow, and more) while trying to chase leads, identify suspects, and gather enough information to help save Gotham City. The game also adds a brand new hidden agenda mechanic, which assigns secret goals and unique win conditions for each player based upon which DC character they portray.

In Batman: Everybody Lies, players utilize a variety of physical and digital game components – a deck of cards with essential clues and plot twists, various physical handouts, and a dedicated website with access to in-world resources from the Gotham City Gazette archives – for a truly immersive experience. The game also features another new thematic treat – Scenes – that bring memorable gameplay moments to life via original comic book illustrations that feel torn straight from the pages and panels of the beloved comics.

Beginning with an introductory Prologue designed to get players acquainted with the game rules, Batman: Everybody Lies then continues with three big cases to solve, each taking roughly 2-3 hours to play. Each case can be played separately as stand-alone episodes, yet should players crack all four cases, they will unravel a master narrative with an epic climax. Every scenario ends with a final report with questions verifying how well the team has investigated the case.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Onitama: Steer and Lobster Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
A set of 2 cards packaged together in Pack A of The Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

These cards provide new movement options for your pieces.

boardgame.name: Zoomway
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

With the discovery of the Corridors of Power, travel across the cosmos - and into Alternate Histories- becomes possible! Zoomways lead to destinations, each a setting for a new adventure!

But with the new exploration come unimaginable dangers, because others -hostile others- are already using the Zoomways...

Complete rules for Lost Astronauts, Pariahs (mutants) and even green Jackalopes to hurtle across the universe through the Zoomways!

Extensive charts for random worlds, random bases, random outposts and random creatures - as well as an Encounter Seeds chart and an intricate Adventure generator.

boardgame.name: Zoomway Dangerous Allies: U.N.O.P.E.R.A.
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

ZOOMWAY Dangerous Allies is a series of supplements for WHITEFRANK: ZOOMWAY providing details of allies - who may carry with them their own agenda and threats.

boardgame.name: Zoomway Masks of Madness
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Gamma Orionis III.

In the prime reality for this planet, all life is wiped out by a solar flare, and nothing more is heard from it. But in Alternate History Psphesec-1979, life has gone on!

Meet the Masker tribes, totem tribespeople who wear mystical Masks as their only armor!

Map of a ruined city and its abandoned silver mine, with keyed descriptions, encounters and some adventure ideas!

boardgame.name: Zoomway Coldfront
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Abbey of Coldfont is under siege, and doesn't even realize it yet...

Earth-71938, 1234 AD. In the middle of a civil war between the burgeoning kingdom of France and the resistance fighters of the Cathars. Into this conflicted but beautiful world of Medieval France come the Zoomway travellers - just in time to try and stop the simple, brutal but potentially world-ending threat of Jaasthur the Mind Eater!

boardgame.name: Zoomway Fire Syndrome
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Like fire, a robot is a good servant -but a bad master!

Finally arriving back on Earth in their own time and their own reality, or one almost identical to it, the Zoomway travellers are caught up in the response to COVID19 Variant Omega: a fully automated quarantine system inside a robotic hotel!

It soon becomes apparent that a malevolent intelligence is directing the hotel androids in a rebellion against humankind... A rebellion that threatens not only the heroes but the whole human race!

boardgame.name: Zoomway Reanimated
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Herbert West -- Reanimator!

A masked spree killer!

A storm-tossed ship trapped in the freezing ocean between Australia and Antarctica!

Survivor horror, killings, improvised weapons - and multiple threats from multiple types of infectious zombies!

Any one threat would test a character - but with so many threats in an enclosed space - is survival even possible?

boardgame.name: Zoomway Fires of Liberty
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

DRAGON WORLD!

Brought to a dead stop inside a Zoomway, the characters must escape -or fight- the forces of the cunning Dragon-God Yelmogus!

boardgame.name: Zoomway Web of the Angry Buddha
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Lamasery in the deepest wilds of Sussex...

A Rinpoche who is more than he seems...

UNOPERA asking for help in solving a baffling series of thefts...

Thieves who may be meddling with an astral force beyond their comprehension!

The characters must investigate the thefts, catch the criminals - and prevent the rise of the Lord of Black Smoke!

boardgame.name: Zoomway Time of the Swarm
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Zoomway travellers arrive on the planet Nessos-Perijene, an overlooked part of the Tri-Silver Federation star empire.

After helping the local settlers against a plague of giant Isopods, the heroes meet "Jane Smith" a fellow alien -and a fellow Zoomway traveller!

But barely have introductions been made and stories swapped when an invasion begins by the dimension-hopping OCTRONS!

boardgame.name: World of Realm Concentric
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

WORLD OF REALM is a major campaign setting for WHITEFRANK. In World of Realm, characters come from a variety of other worlds, or are native born descendants of those outworlders, engaged in fantasy battles, quests, adventures and sometimes desperate struggles against existential threats to existence as it is understood.

boardgame.name: Here to Slay: Howl of the Dead mini and promo card
boardgame.description:
Howl of the Dead: Discard a Hero or Item card.
Card text:
If you Discard a Hero card, Destroy a Hero card.
If you Discard an Item card, add a Hero card from the discard pile to your hand."

Howl of the Dead is a new mini in the Here to Slay Vinyl Mini Series which comes with a promo card.

boardgame.name: Saturdayness
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Adventures in a fairy tale / Saturday morning cartoon world!

Based on public domain 1900s fairy tale books and maps, public domain Oz books and the beautiful illustrations that brought them to life!

Loads of character classes, treasures to quest for, monsters and maps of the Caves of Shirewood, the Land of Saturdayness, a cavern generator, and writeups of Santa, the Snow Queen, Queen Titania, Elder Boss the Dragon King, the Water-Dragon and many more!

With an ethos of non-lethal combat wherever possible, the Saturdayness world promotes family gaming even for the youngest gamers, and brings to life the stories with which they are most familiar. Having said that, it's also excellent for gamers of all ages, especially those looking for something genuinely different!

A complete listing of all the map locations provides characters, creatures, items and adventures for each of the locations as well as interlinking the areas and characters into several different possible campaigns, whether it is helping King Richozmard, stopping his scheming brother from stealing the throne, going on quests for Good Witches, fighting Giants, helping the magical little creatures that hide among the flowers, or battling Pirates, Bogles, Nomes or hideous shapeshifters!

A plethora of Fairies are detailed along with the sort of mischief they will do if not stopped.

New Magic Spells include those used by Santa, Witches and Fairies, and the final section of the book is a long list of Magic Things -items and creatures- each of which can form the basis for a quest or in some cases - an entire campaign!

boardgame.name: Here to Slay: Reigning King mini and promo card
boardgame.description:
Reigning King:
Card text: Choose a Class. Destroy all Hero cards of that Class.

Reigning King is a new mini in the Here to Slay Vinyl Mini Series which comes with a promo card.

boardgame.name: Monkey on Your Back
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Earth, 4041 AD!

After Dies Irae and the Final War, Humanity has Fallen. Where Humanity once ruled supreme, now rule... The ANIMALS!

Post-apocalypse sandbox adventures in a post-disaster world.

Charts for Pure humans, Pariahs (Mutant Humans), Machines, Cyborgs, Refuges, Sleepers and Lost Astronauts!

A myriad of Mutant Animals!

Exploring random terrain in detail, looking for Pre-Fall items and weapons!

Huge list of monsters, items, many vehicles, weapons, Pre- and Post- Fall armour!

Groups and Cults!

Play it as science fiction, science fantasy or way out psychedelic techno-fantasy!

boardgame.name: Nine Springs Falls
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Nine Springs Falls is an adventure based on a title from Chris Bissette's Random Adventure Title Generator and produced as an entry for the Random Adventure Jam.

The adventure is based in and around a karst cave system and features:

- four NPC types with random name tables
- six adventure hooks
- a random encounter table
- thirty random treasures

NPC and encounter statistics are provided for use with Highland Paranormal Society's Tunnel Goons.

boardgame.name: U'reanion
boardgame.description: A homebrew race for 5e.

boardgame.name: Throne Rats
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Game of Thrones meets Root RPG, mashed up into a one-page game. In the year 6XX AD, all truces are broken. Now every land holds a different banner. The ravens fight to keep traditions. The foxes stave off creatures from the west. The wolves march hungrily to expand their domain.

But our kingdom was by far the worst. The greediest. Now the king is dead. May he reign in hell. This city is free. We must never let it fall.

THRONE RATS is a one-page RPG created for the game(s) jam. Meet a dark medieval world of intrigue and war. Drop your friends in the middle of the action!

Play as anthropomorphic animals as they survive gritty and violent lands. Take the throne or fight off usurpers. It's past time for us all to pick a side.

boardgame.name: Colony X
boardgame.description:
In Colony X, you play the role of a space foreman working for a billion dollar corporation. Your mission? Establish a sustainable colony on a distant planet.

Colony X is a 2-4 player game featuring area control and colony building. Each turn players land one of their ships on a nearby planet to collect two resources from an ever-changing pool of resources or use one of their ships to visit an architect to construct a new building for their colony. But be warned, after construction future buildings will cost less for your opponents.

The game takes place over four rounds. At the end of each round, the player with the most ships on a planet gains its influence token which is needed to complete work orders and increase the value of certain buildings.

At the end of the final round, the player with the most Victory Points tallied from their buildings, influence, and completed work orders is the winner.

boardgame.name: Advanced Dungeons & Dragons Dungeon Masters Guide as Interpreted and Envisioned by Phil Knopp, DM
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is a compilation of house rules, errata, notes, and details of interpretations that I as DM employ in running my fantasy campaigns. I have also included a variety of articles and commentary I have selectively chosen for its quality and similarity to my personal views from a variety of sources. The majority of my gaming experience is based on the traditional 1st edition AD&D rule books and other core material. I have customized and elaborated upon these rules over the years to become tailored to my gaming preferences, style, and personal tastes and have codified my personal variations in my version of the Player’s Handbook as an accepted set of house rules I will DM. This said, I have found at least a few additional game mechanics that I feel comfortable using in my campaigns, any of which I consider valid and all of which can be used to adjudicate the interaction in my campaign world Multiverse based on the consensus between myself and my players.

The chromatic dragons are also the spawn of Tiamat, Each of the sub-race (Precious Metallic, Chromatic, Land, ‘Elemental’, Oriental, Ferrous, Gemstone, Dragonel/Drakes, and Wyrms) of dragon descends from a separate consort of Bahamut. Each dragon sort will be treated individually hereafter. General information and common characteristics will be given here.

boardgame.name: Things to Know About Drow
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Ages past, when the elven folk were but new to the face of the earth, their number was torn by discord. Those of the sunlight world came into deadly conflict with their drow cousins. Warfare between the two divisions of elvenkind continues, with an uneasy division of the sunlight world for the elves and faeries and the Under Dark held by the drow. The subterranean area between these realms remains an inhospitable no-mans land. The dark elves have sought the safety and security in the realm of the underworld. Here, in lightless caverns and endless warrens of twisting passages and caves hung with icicles of stone, the dark elven folk – the drow – find both refuge and comfort. Over the centuries they grew strong once again and schooled themselves in arcane arts. And though they were strong enough to face and perhaps defeat their former brethren in battle, the drow no longer see advantage in walking upon the green lands under the sun and stars. They do not desire a life in the upper world, being content with the gloomy fairyland beneath the earth that they had made their own. Yet they neither forgave nor forgot, and even now, above all else, they bear enmity for all of their distant kin – elves and faeries – who opposed them so long ago both down beneath the earth and in the meadows and dells of the bright world. Though they are seldom if ever seen by any human or demi-human, the drow still persist, occasionally entering the subterranean world and consorting with other creatures towards their own ends.

boardgame.name: Things to Know About Dwarves
boardgame.description:
